issue.title: Document version support more accurately
issue.body:
Version support at https://pouchdb.com/learn.html is out of date:

![Screenshot_2023-10-19_08-22-18](https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/assets/191496/bdb8c60a-5f24-4bc4-be7b-6584a87cb241)

It would be helpful to update this page, and add a table of older pouch versions and which browsers they support.

comment.body: @alxndrsn I am guessing we would have to test using something like Browserstack?

pages.title: Who or What Is Using Pouch

issue.title: uuid@3.2.1: Please upgrade  to version 7 or higher.  Older versions may use Math.random() in certain circumstances, which is known to be problematic.  See https://v8.dev/blog/math-random for details
Document version support more accurately

comment.body: Hey @alxndrsn can I work on this?

issue.title: indexeddb find indexes can cause collisions for paths with special characters
issue.body:
[`pouchdb-adapter-indexeddb`'s `sanitise()`/`rewrite()` functions](https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/blob/70bd2afcdc908bc4cb964dde15544ca1eb1f1654/packages/node_modules/pouchdb-adapter-indexeddb/src/rewrite.js) can cause collisions, as different strings map to the same values, e.g.:

```js
> sanitise('a/b')
'a_c47_b'
> sanitise('a_c47_b')
'a_c47_b'
> sanitise('a/b', true)
'a_c47_b'
> sanitise('a_c47_b', true)
'a_c47_b'
```

issue.title: PouchDB in Nextjs throws error
issue.body: ### Issue Whenever I try running my nextjs app using pouchDB (I am only using it on the server side and **NOT** on the client side) I get Am I missing something? ### Info - Environment: (Nextjs (backend code Node.js)) - Platform: (Brave) - Adapter: (leveldb) - Server: (no server, I am working in local with in nextjs) ### Reproduce Initi a nextjs app. Setup pouchDB ``` import PouchDB from "pouchdb-node"; const db = new PouchDB("llmshare"); export default db; ``` use pouchDB in any API's `route.ts` ``` import { NextResponse } from "next/server"; import db from "@/db/pouchDB"; export async function GET() { try { const res = await db.post({ title: "new code" }); return NextResponse.json({ id: res.id }); } catch (e) { console.log({ e }); } } ```

comment.body:
> If anyone can share a minimal reproduction of the issue, it would probably help if someone is looking to fix it.

Here's a [codesandbox](https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/zen-chandrasekhar-gjgy2r?file=%2Fapp%2Fpage.jsx%3A6%2C31)

issue.title: indexeddb: add checkBlobSupport()
issue.body:
Add support to the indexeddb adapter for browsers which do not support storing blobs directly in IndexedDB.

In current webkit, this error is seen as:

> Error [DataCloneError]: Failed to store record in an IDBObjectStore: BlobURLs are not yet supported.

Closes #8803

Blocked by:

* https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/pull/8802

comment.body:
> Yes - checkBlobSupport() is pulled out of pouchdb-adapter-idb.

Got it! Thanks.

comment.body: IIRC it mostly came from `adapter.js` in `pouchd-core`.  You're right that there's probably more code that could be shared

pull_request.title: indexeddb.get(open_revs): don't re-fetch docs
pull_request.body:
This significantly improves performance when replicating from a PouchDB using `indexeddb` adapter with conflicted docs.

However, it may not be a common-enough scenario to deserve the extra complexity.

New perf test cases are included to demonstrate the improved performance.  Existing test cases do not show significant change.

Example perf test runs:

```
                                                   | 288714d | f55b7d5
---------------------------------------------------+---------+---------
 gets-open-revs                                    |     934 |     143
 pull-replication-one-generation                   |    1165 |    1189
 pull-replication-one-generation-reverse           |     757 |     785
 pull-replication-two-generation                   |    1171 |    1139
 pull-replication-two-generation-reverse           |     752 |     769
 pull-replication-one-generation-open-revs         |   16736 |   16524
 pull-replication-one-generation-open-revs-reverse |   11872 |    5164
 pull-replication-two-generation-open-revs         |   16852 |   16831
 pull-replication-two-generation-open-revs-reverse |   11744 |    4858
```

issue.title: indexeddb: add checkBlobSupport()
issue.body:
Add support to the indexeddb adapter for browsers which do not support storing blobs directly in IndexedDB.

In current webkit, this error is seen as:

> Error [DataCloneError]: Failed to store record in an IDBObjectStore: BlobURLs are not yet supported.

Closes #8803

Blocked by:

* https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/pull/8802

comment.body:
> I take it we're only storing this in the meta data because of your comment about not wanting to change function signatures to pass it through?

Yes.  Also `pouchdb-adapter-idb` does something similar - passing via `api._meta`.  I think it would be less hacky to pass the `metadata` object to any `pouchdb-adapter-indexeddb` function which needs it.

issue.title: indexeddb: add checkBlobSupport()
issue.body:
Add support to the indexeddb adapter for browsers which do not support storing blobs directly in IndexedDB.

In current webkit, this error is seen as:

> Error [DataCloneError]: Failed to store record in an IDBObjectStore: BlobURLs are not yet supported.

Closes #8803

Blocked by:

* https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/pull/8802

comment.body:
> Does the old idb adapter support webkit, and if so, does it do it in the same way?

Yes - `checkBlobSupport()` is pulled out of `pouchdb-adapter-idb`.
No - this is the fix from https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/pull/8802/files

review.body:
It looks complicated and I'm not sure I get it. I take it we're only storing this in the meta data because of your comment about not wanting to change function signatures to pass it through?

Does the old idb adapter support webkit, and if so, does it do it in the same way?

comment.body: `reverse` is ambiguous... initially I thought this was referring to `descending`. What about `source="remote"` or similar?

pull_request.title: indexeddb.get(open_revs): don't re-fetch docs
pull_request.body:
This significantly improves performance when replicating from a PouchDB using `indexeddb` adapter with conflicted docs.

However, it may not be a common-enough scenario to deserve the extra complexity.

New perf test cases are included to demonstrate the improved performance.  Existing test cases do not show significant change.

Example perf test runs:

```
                                                   | 288714d | f55b7d5
---------------------------------------------------+---------+---------
 gets-open-revs                                    |     934 |     143
 pull-replication-one-generation                   |    1165 |    1189
 pull-replication-one-generation-reverse           |     757 |     785
 pull-replication-two-generation                   |    1171 |    1139
 pull-replication-two-generation-reverse           |     752 |     769
 pull-replication-one-generation-open-revs         |   16736 |   16524
 pull-replication-one-generation-open-revs-reverse |   11872 |    5164
 pull-replication-two-generation-open-revs         |   16852 |   16831
 pull-replication-two-generation-open-revs-reverse |   11744 |    4858
```

review.body: Nice improvement! The main question is about where the new code came from, which will help me understand the complexity tradeoff.
